instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message:
macbook 17' <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board , no back light

known good screen and LVDS CABLE , TESTED
new lvds connector on board,

<CAPACITOR>C9880</CAPACITOR> = 39v


still no back light


feedback connection good

any idea why no back light


<TRANSISTOR>Q9701</TRANSISTOR> pin 1234 0.4v !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message: the machine is not detecting the screen. double check the screen connector. if ok then check for short to ground on all 30 pins( especially pin 1234).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message:
Of course the screen is detected else there would be nothing on BKL line!

PWM is missing. PRAM reset done?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
threads.message: yes PRAM reset done , no result ... still no back light

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no back light
